intro: Hypogomphia turkestana f. elatior, commonly known as the Turkestan hypogomphia, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is adapted to grow in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
